intro: Geissorhiza platystigma, commonly known as the yellow rain lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has strap-shaped leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating, which helps it retain moisture in its arid habitat. Its bulbs are underground storage organs that allow it to survive periods of drought. Geissorhiza platystigma is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
